noun.description: A domestic fowl kept for its eggs or meat, especially a young one.
A game in which the first person to lose nerve and withdraw from a dangerous situation is the loser.

examples: they were too chicken to follow the murderers into the mountains

verb.description: Withdraw from or fail in something through lack of nerve.
examples: the referee chickened out of giving a penalty

origin: Old English cīcen, cȳcen, of Germanic origin; related to Dutch kieken and German Küchlein, and probably also to cock.
